displayProperties.description: Deposit collected samples at Failsafe's Radiolite Bay in the H.E.L.M.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES001

3939248478.displaySource: "Radiolite Bay is up and running! The 'Drifter' called it a trash can, and by the looks of him, he knows trash!" —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Discover developments about Nessus and the Vex by collecting research specimens for Failsafe to analyze. The more she can research, the more her capabilities will grow.
setData.questStepSummary:
Failsafe has fabricated a Piston Hammer for you from a mix of old Red Legion mining tech and new Vex assimilation patterns. The hammer is capable of uncovering Vex radiolite!

Activate Vex Assimilation Pistons in Episode: Echoes activities by striking them with the hammer to initiate a planetoid quake, revealing buried radiolite. Radiolite Incubators will rise to the surface and their radiolite can be extracted with your sampler.

These quakes are slowly reshaping the planetoid and breaking down the mantle.

displayProperties.description: Failsafe has fabricated a Piston Hammer for you. Striking Vex Assimilation Pistons with it will drive nearby veins of Radiolite to the surface for sampling.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES001

setData.questLineDescription: Discover developments about Nessus and the Vex by collecting research specimens for Failsafe to analyze. The more she can research, the more her capabilities will grow.
setData.questStepSummary: Failsafe learned a great deal from your data collection and has some additional findings to share with you.

displayProperties.description:
Failsafe has found that the incubator specimen contains remnants of both radiolite and base radiolaria. She requires more ambient data from interactions with Vex.

Secure Extracted Data for Failsafe in the Breach Executable activity, which can be launched from the H.E.L.M.

Higher-difficulty completions grant faster progress.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES001

3922470891.displaySource:
"See you on the field, Captain." —Failsafe
"For field research!" —Also Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Discover developments about Nessus and the Vex by collecting research specimens for Failsafe to analyze. The more she can research, the more her capabilities will grow.
setData.questStepSummary:
Failsafe has asked you to extract additional Vex data to further her research. She has diverted Vanguard resources to your deployment.

Research Instrument Fabricated: Munitions Deployment Apparatus - When receiving a buff in Breach Executable, also unlock extra relics or munitions to aid you in combat.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES001

3905693304.displaySource: "First research project in the bag. We could keep this up forever, right?" —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Discover developments about Nessus and the Vex by collecting research specimens for Failsafe to analyze. The more she can research, the more her capabilities will grow.
setData.questStepSummary:
Your Radiolite research has advanced Failsafe's capabilities!

Research Instrument Fabricated:

Primary Echo Engram Focusing - Focus Echo Engrams into weapons and armor at Failsafe in the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description: Travel to the H.E.L.M. and place the Seized Radiolite Incubator into your specimen collection.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES001

4023136637.displaySource:
Failsafe greets you. "Captain! our efforts should be commemorated, so I fabricated a display for all of the specimens that you collect…"

Her tone flattens. "…and I get into the nitty-gritty details—the research."

Her tone takes a pleasant affect. "Exciting times!"

setData.questLineDescription: Discover developments about Nessus and the Vex by collecting research specimens for Failsafe to analyze. The more she can research, the more her capabilities will grow.
setData.questStepSummary: The Seized Radiolite Incubator can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
Failsafe's current hypothesis is that specimen NES003 originates from a Vex combatant. 

Defeat Goblins or Fanatics to identify potential molecular similarities.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES003

2404057711.displaySource: "Scientific research is at its best when conducted with firearms." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Goblins and Fanatics can be found anywhere on Nessus.

displayProperties.description:
The specimen's molecular signature does not match that of Vex Goblins or Fanatics. 

Defeat Hobgoblins or Harpies to continue narrowing the field.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES003

2420835266.displaySource:
"Oh no, not the poor little Vex!" —Failsafe
"That was sarcasm. Please explode as many of them as you like." —Failsafe, again

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Hobgoblins and Harpies are Vex combatants that can be found on Nessus.

displayProperties.description:
The specimen doesn't match Hobgoblin or Harpy signatures either.

Defeat a Minotaur, Wyvern, Cyclops, and Hydra to identify a final match.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES003

2437612981.displaySource: "The Guardian's going toe-to-toe with some of the biggest, baddest Vex out there! Kick their butts, Captain." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Minotaurs, Wyverns, Cyclops, and Hydras are Vex combatants that can be found on Nessus.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES003

2320169648.displaySource: "We did it again! Look at us go." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Breach Executable Iridescent Radiolite Extractor - Always find a random Iridescent Radiolite in the chest at the end of the Breach Executable activity (two on Expert difficulty).

displayProperties.description: Travel to the H.E.L.M. and place the Assimilated Wyvern Shield-Wing in your specimen collection.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES003

2336947235.displaySource:
"Another one in the tank! Adding our specimens really makes this H.E.L.M. feel like a H.O.M.E., don't you think?"

Failsafe pauses to think of what the acronym H.O.M.E. could stand for.

Occupied with this puzzle, she does not reply to any further questions.

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: The Assimilated Wyvern Shield-Wing can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
Failsafe believes NES002 originates from a location of great power on Nessus. 

Complete patrols, public events, and Lost Sectors to triangulate the source of this specimen. Scrape additional ambient data by completing Failsafe bounties.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES002

4056667496.displaySource: "I need help from someone with two legs and one Sparrow. Sound like anybody you know?"—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary:
Failsafe reminds you that you can pick up additional bounties by visiting her in the Exodus Black on Nessus. In return for your help, and in hope of future compliance, she would like to offer an upgrade. She repeats that this is definitely not a bribe.

Research Instrument Fabricated: Duration Calibrator Device - Increases the duration of buffs you receive in the Breach Executable activity.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES002

4090222670.displaySource: "I believe we are getting the hang of this research thing! Ever thought about going into the sciences full time?"—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary:
Failsafe is proud of the work you've done together.

Research Instrument Fabricated: Weekly Deepsight Focusing - The first Echo Weapon you focus each week is guaranteed to have Deepsight Resonance.

displayProperties.description: Travel to the H.E.L.M. and place the Well Constellation Fragments in your specimen collection.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES002

4140555527.displaySource:
Failsafe cheers for your joint work on this new specimen.

"You on fieldwork, me at the desk: we make a great pair. And this thing makes a great decoration for my office."

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: The Well Constellation Fragments can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
This specimen is modified passcode encryption tech.

Open Echo Chests at the end of Episode: Echoes activities in the H.E.L.M. to decrypt the algorithm.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES004

1818579185.displaySource: "Data is the best loot. You can keep all the other junk." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex, and let Failsafe 2.1 stretch her wings, by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Echo Chests can be opened after succeeding in an Episode: Echoes activity.

displayProperties.description:
The algorithm can only be unlocked with a unique energy signature. 

Failsafe can replicate this signature by focusing Echo Engrams into Echo gear in the H.E.L.M.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES004

1768246328.displaySource: "I need data. You always need gear. Legally speaking, that's a win-win." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex, and let Failsafe 2.1 stretch her wings, by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Focus Echo Engrams with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
This unique specimen has additional layers of encryption that are particularly tough to decrypt. Failsafe requires more ambient data from interactions with Vex.

Secure Extracted Data for Failsafe in the Breach Executable activity and fight your way through Echoes Battlegrounds.

Episode: Echoes activities can be launched from the H.E.L.M.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES004

1785023915.displaySource: "I always love to watch you work, Captain. Especially when that work is disintegrating the Vex." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex, and let Failsafe 2.1 stretch her wings, by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary:
Continuing to extract more Vex data from Nessus has improved Failsafe's research capabilities.

Collecting and depositing Extracted Data grants buffs for your fireteam and will aid Failsafe in her research.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES004

1868911946.displaySource: "I love the smell of a completed report in the morning. Or I would if I had olfactory capabilities." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex, and let Failsafe 2.1 stretch her wings, by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Armor Reputation Booster - Reputation earned through the Seasonal armor perk is increased by 100%.

displayProperties.description: Travel to the H.E.L.M. and place the Mirror-Encrypted Hydra Tail in your specimen collection.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES004

1885689661.displaySource: "When is a tail more than a tail? Turns out, when it's a data jack." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex, and let Failsafe 2.1 stretch her wings, by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: The Mirror-Encrypted Hydra Tail can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
Failsafe is concerned that this specimen looks hungry and has run an analysis of its dietary needs.

Collect Iridescent Radiolite to find nutritional clusters within. Failsafe calls these clusters "Bufo Bites," and believes they mirror the animal's natural food source.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES005

2160121874.displaySource: "I cannot find a single thing on the H.E.L.M. to feed our new specimen! We need the perfect snacks for our perfect little guy." —Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Failsafe needs raw data for her analysis of this specimen. She's eager to get hopping on her report.
setData.questStepSummary:
Iridescent Radiolite nodes are most commonly found after activating a planetary piston at the start of Episode: Echoes activities.

Research Instrument Fabricated: Piston Hammer Recharging - Using the Piston Hammer will occasionally recharge itself instead of consuming a hammer charge.

displayProperties.description:
To keep this specimen happy, healthy, and enriched, it will need a natural habitat.

Collect flora from Nessus to prepare a small terrarium in the H.E.L.M.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES005

2143344319.displaySource: "If we do a good enough job, our specimen will never want to leave its tank. I won't be alone, even if you get bored of me. How wonderful!"—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Failsafe needs raw data for her analysis of this specimen. She's eager to get hopping on her report.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Advanced Radiolite Analysis - Improves rewards earned by depositing Radiolite samples in the Radiolite Bay.

displayProperties.description:
The H.E.L.M. doesn't have room for more than one specimen. That doesn't mean its species should go unprotected.

Defeat Vex on Nessus to ensure a safe habitat.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES005

2126566604.displaySource: "This specimen is much cuter than any Vex I have ever encountered. Priorities set accordingly, Captain."—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Failsafe needs raw data for her analysis of this specimen. She's eager to get hopping on her report.
setData.questStepSummary: Defeat Vex on Nessus.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES005

2109789017.displaySource: Failsafe is thinking long and deeply about this latest specimen.

setData.questLineDescription: Failsafe needs raw data for her analysis of this specimen. She's eager to get hopping on her report.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Secondary Echo Engram Focusing - unlocks the ability to focus Echo Engrams into Act II weapons.

displayProperties.description: Give Captain Jacobson a new home in the H.E.L.M.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES005

2093011430.displaySource:
"I will feed him and play with him and sing him little frog songs every day. We are best friends."

Failsafe pauses and rethinks that.

"Oh, do not feel bad! You are also my best friend, Captain."

setData.questLineDescription: Failsafe needs raw data for her analysis of this specimen. She's eager to get hopping on her report.
setData.questStepSummary: Captain Jacobson can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description:
This specimen is a Vex weapon of some kind. However, it is as yet impossible to pinpoint what kind of Vex wielded it.

Defeat combatants with Sidearms or Auto Rifles to narrow down the weapon's projectile type. Defeating other Guardians grants bonus progress.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES006

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Defeat combatant with Sidearms or Auto Rifles.

displayProperties.description:
The weapon is calibrated to do medium amounts of damage. The next step to narrowing down its source is identifying its damage type.

Defeat combatants with Arc or Solar damage to provide a signature reading. Defeating other Guardians grants bonus progress.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES006

221085078.displaySource: "Well, it's not Void. Beyond that, who knows? Us, in a little while. Up and at 'em, Captain!"—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Defeat combatants using Arc or Solar damage.

displayProperties.description:
The specimen appears to deal Arc damage through a modified power source.

Generate Orbs of Power to generate some potential comparison data for Failsafe to study. Orbs generated in Crucible or Gambit generate bonus progress.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES006

237862665.displaySource: "Arc energy can feel different depending on how it's used. The flow changes. Ghost knows what I mean."—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Data-Formatting Keys - Unlocks additional engrams from opening Echo chests with Echo Keys.

displayProperties.description: Speak with Failsafe in the H.E.L.M. to review her final specimen analysis report.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES006

254640380.displaySource: "You've got the brawn, and I've got the brains! I also have the report."—Failsafe

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: Research Instrument Fabricated: Combat Protocol Override - Detects the presence of high-value targets in Echoes Battlegrounds. Defeat the high-value targets for bonus rewards.

displayProperties.description: Travel to the H.E.L.M. and place the Assimilated Torch Hammer in your specimen collection.
displayProperties.name: Specimen ID: NES006

271417967.displaySource:
There is an unexpected wistful note to Failsafe's voice.

"If I could power this up, I would not be asking you to place it behind glass. I still miss my railguns."

setData.questLineDescription: Learn more about the changing nature of Nessus and the Vex by researching this specimen.
setData.questStepSummary: The Assimilated Torch Hammer can be placed in the specimen display at the H.E.L.M.

displayProperties.description: Complete a match in the Competitive playlist.
displayProperties.name: Dividing the Ladder

3995422990.displaySource: "Well? What did you think? Are you challenged to greater glories?" —Lord Shaxx, eagerly

displayProperties.description: Complete your Placement Series matches to establish your starting position on the tiered ladder.
displayProperties.name: Dividing the Ladder

3995422991.displaySource: "Welcome to your new Division, Guardian! Beside your peers, you will achieve greater heights still." —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description: Return to Lord Shaxx in the Tower.
displayProperties.name: Dividing the Ladder

3995422988.displaySource: "Wonderful! You look stronger already. I look forward to the heights you will climb!" —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description: Complete a match in the New Territory playlist.
displayProperties.name: Forged Anew

3934247791.displaySource: "Prove to these New Lights that you're still the best there is, no matter the battlefield!" —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description: Complete matches in each New Territory. Earn bonus progress for wins.
displayProperties.name: Forged Anew

3934247790.displaySource: "These arenas have been scientifically designed to be AS DANGEROUS AS POSSIBLE! Enjoy the thrill of you imminent demise!" —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description: Return to Lord Shaxx in the Tower.
displayProperties.name: Forged Anew

3934247789.displaySource: "Wonderful! You look stronger already. I look forward to the heights you will climb!" —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description: Speak with Saint-14 in the Tower Hangar.
displayProperties.name: Trials Returns

displayProperties.description:
Your zeal is noted, friend, but your Light requires refinement. As the acting officiator of the Trials of Osiris, Saint-14 has assessed the necessary requirements for entry. His assessment has set the entry bar at a measurable Power of {var:3800354482}. While every Guardian has strength in their own right, some do not yet have the battle experience to operate seamlessly in a Trials fireteam.

Reach Power {var:3800354482}, complete your Competitive Placement Matches, and defeat opponents in Competitive Crucible to participate in the Trials of Osiris.
displayProperties.name: Trials Access

1359460005.displaySource: "Believe me, this is for the best. Return when you are ready, and I will gladly issue your card." —Saint-14

displayProperties.description: Return to Saint-14 in the Tower Hangar.
displayProperties.name: Trials Access

1359460004.displaySource: "In my arena, you will fight together, or you will fail." —Saint-14

displayProperties.description: Acquire a Trials Passage from Saint-14 to begin the Trials of Osiris. Play a game, win a round, and eliminate an opponent.
displayProperties.name: Trials Access

1359460007.displaySource: "We will need heroes, leaders, as we did at the Gap, at Six Fronts. You will make me proud." —Saint-14

displayProperties.description: Return to Saint-14 in the Tower Hangar for your reward: a weapon to help secure future victories.
displayProperties.name: Trials Access

1359460006.displaySource: "A powerful weapon is not the sole arbiter of victory. Nor is the skill of the Guardian who wields it."  —Osiris

displayProperties.description: Complete a match in Iron Banner.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

684710075.displaySource: "The legacy of the Iron Lords is no slight thing. Do you have what it takes to honor that legacy?" —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description: Complete a daily challenge.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

684710074.displaySource: "To claim victory, you must think beyond mere tactics. Prove your ability to juggle long-term concerns with the immediacy of battle." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description: Earn Iron Banner Rank points.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

684710073.displaySource: "You are improving. Keep on the war path." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description: Collect an Iron Banner engram from Lord Saladin.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

displayProperties.description: Complete Iron Banner matches while wearing at least one piece of Iron Banner armor. Each additional piece grants extra progress.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

684710079.displaySource: "The Iron Banner is an auspicious event. Dressing for the occasion isn't required, but it is appreciated." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description: Speak to Lord Saladin at the Tower.
displayProperties.name: Forging Iron

684710078.displaySource: "Watching young cubs become wolves… there are few responsibilities more thrilling." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description:
As a team, earn points by defeating enemy Guardians in Iron Banner.

Available only during Season of Opulence.
displayProperties.name: Wolf's Clothing

85374308.displaySource: "Iron Banner is an opportunity to push yourself. You know your strengths. Now find your weaknesses." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description:
Return to Lord Saladin to collect your reward and continue the journey.

Available only during Season of Opulence.
displayProperties.name: Wolf's Clothing

3524526597.displaySource: "With each victory, you honor the legacy of the Iron Lords. Come and see me, Guardian." —Lord Saladin

displayProperties.description:

displayProperties.description: Around you… darkness. If you are to discover your path, you must anchor yourself to light.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

3715926175.displaySource:
"It was hard to see the point of a single fireteam taking on Crota, but it was easy to understand how retribution had driven us there. The names of everyone we'd lost in that needless disaster were etched across the walls of the Last City, each and every one a reminder that they were gone and we were not. So when Eriana-3 came knocking, it was a simple decision. From top to bottom, we'd avenge every one of those names. A fire burned in all six of us. We were gonna make sure Crota knew it."

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: A light shines on your path. But you have yet to bring it into focus. Until then, your path remains among the lost.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

3710486535.displaySource:
"For me, there was no return from Crota. I lacked hope. Made me not the easiest to get along with. I knew that. But it didn't matter to Eris. She saw hope in me where I wouldn't. Wanted to say thanks, so I tried to gift her a trinket, but she rejected it. Eris wasn't looking for gratitude; she truly saw hope in us all. On our own, we were nothing. But as she'd always remind us, lost as we might be, true strength came from our union.

"Eris's words rang in my ears as the Hive tore my Light from my soul."

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: Your path brightens, shining through the barrier of emerald, beneath a harbor built from sorrow.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

2269402074.displaySource:
"The worst part about what the Hive did to us wasn't the killing. It was the separation. Splitting us up made us weak. They dragged me deep below the lunar surface, through a wall of endless doors. Strung me up. Made my Ghost, Karsys, watch as they tore my Light away, like stripping muscle from bone. Then they killed Karsys in front of me. Sure would've been nice then to have had some of that hope Eris had been peddling."

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: The Pariahs stand guard over far more than just despair, for within these tunnels lie many secrets.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

1503907116.displaySource:
"I did see one familiar face before the end. I'm not sure how she found me—probably followed the Hive's trail of runes or something.

"The resilience of Eris Morn—her greatest strength and her greatest weakness. To see the Heart of Crota peel my Light away and feed it to those disgusting little maggots and yet do nothing to stop it… She made the right call. 'Else the fire in us both might've gone out that day. I'd never blame her."

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: The end of your path is in sight. Defeat those who would keep you from it.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

60788839.displaySource:
"Eris did something truly kind for me, however, in those final moments. When she found me strung up, I saw her clutching the trinket I had made her—the one she'd rejected—tightly against her chest. I never forgot that. She'd made sure in that moment that the fire in my heart didn't go out. Made sure I knew I wasn't alone. The fire in me raged. What I would've given to stand with my fireteam one last time and burn those heathens to oblivion!"

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: Return to Eris Morn with the Hive bug.
displayProperties.name: The Journey

1465888553.displaySource:
"As they peeled away my Light piece by piece, the dark began to set in. I went limp. My mind started to fade. But the fire raged on.

"It's a funny thing, dying for good twice. I imagine my first death was frightening. But this one was calming. This time I knew I wasn't really gone forever. Neither were my friends. Vell. Eriana. Sai. Toland. …Eris. There was peace in that. Knowing we'd always be together, somewhere. Somehow.

"I felt my spirit leave my body through my Light. And then—only darkness."

—A loyal friend

displayProperties.description: Eris Morn believes the Hive's wicked science can be turned against them. Help her investigate the Circle of Bones beneath the Moon.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

613601972.displaySource: "The Hive are a festering sickness. A living plague of bone and suffering. But there are methods through which their affliction may be turned against them." —Eris Morn

displayProperties.description: Your understanding of the Hive's Deathsong has only just begun. Take the Silent Skull to Eris Morn.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

3908666296.displaySource: "The skull is silent, but its hollowed bone hides secret knowledge. The channels etched within its hard palate and jaw were engraved over centuries by her terrible song, like water carving stone." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: Collect bones from public events near the Hellmouth, the Lost Sector K1 Revelation in Sorrow's Harbor, and a wandering Bone Collector on the Moon.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

1479328354.displaySource: "Gather wicked bone to serve as the conduit for your wretched symphony. Through the fetid marrow, new frequencies will be discovered—new horrors… And you… their willing conductor." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: Enter the Scarlet Keep strike and slay the High Conductor, Sulmâkta, within.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

926942410.displaySource: "The Singers' melody, sung through gnarled throat from cracked lung, is but a weapon like any other—nurtured by the will of a sinister witch. Sever the head of the High Conductor, whose temporal bone is a dark mirror of the Singers' carved palate." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: Record your enemies' screams. Defeat base combatants to record discomfort. Defeat elites and minibosses to record pain. Defeat bosses and other Guardians to record anguish. Screams gathered on the Moon count more.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

1325063399.displaySource: "And with their screams, we shall map the language of pain and scrawl a new masterpiece—the vile sheet music of damnation, a strange, new song of bloodied ear, carved flesh, and shattered bone, so that their symphony of torment may be turned against them." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: Fight your way into the depths of the Circle of Bones, survive the Aria, and defeat the Deathsinger, Ir Airâm. Then, bring her skull to Eris Morn.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

1961485542.displaySource: "The wicked one who would see the Deathsingers' Choir reborn has been heard in the depths. It is her song—unique in its sorrow—that will complete your mastery of symphonic arcana. Survive the Aria. Survive the depths and her wretched melody, and then collect one final instrument: the Singing Skull of Ir Airâm." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: Bring the Singing Skull to Eris Morn to complete your terrifying new instrument of war.
displayProperties.name: Symphony of Death

2887971121.displaySource: "The skulls have been gathered, and the final instrument set to join your symphony… the eroded grooves upon their jaws, cheeks, and palates providing the secret frequencies of the hallowed Deathsong. Its mysteries are now ours to bind and enslave. Its power is now yours to inflict at will. You are choir and conductor. You are, as ever, death." —Toland, the Shattered

displayProperties.description: "We found this on the corpse of that Vex Minotaur on the Moon. It's a core of some kind. Definitely Vex made… but I can't verify exactly what, when, where… or why. We could find the information we need by tapping into a Vex construct, but there are none on the Moon…" —Ghost
displayProperties.name: Divine Fragmentation

displayProperties.description: "I had to dig deep into encrypted Vex data to find anything regarding the core. I didn't find much—only that it's designed for decryption of something and that its origin lies with the Sol Divisive Vex. I couldn't learn anything further. It's broken and its data is largely corrupted. We might be able to repair it if we had access to Sol Divisive parts." —Ghost
displayProperties.name: Divine Fragmentation

displayProperties.description: "The Decryption Core is mended, but remains inactive. I was able to mine it for further data, and there are segments of data in a language I'm unable to decipher. Let me see if I can define its resonant energy pattern—wait, what? That's the same energy that pulsates from the Nightmare Essences. The energy signature is weak, but we should have the means to empower it." —Ghost
displayProperties.name: Divine Fragmentation

displayProperties.description: "I've fully analyzed the Decryption Core now that we've empowered it. There's a ton more data in here—but again, I don't understand most of its language. I was able to extract some key information, sporadic words here and there. 'Garden… Defenses… Guardians…' I haven't made complete sense of it yet, but there's only one Garden I know of associated with the Sol Divisive." —Ghost
displayProperties.name: Divine Fragmentation

displayProperties.description: Banshee has a new Exotic weapon catalyst for you—but first he needs a favor.
displayProperties.name: The Vow

55722088.displaySource: "Every weapon's got a lesson to teach. Most ain't pretty, but the education just might save your life." —Banshee

displayProperties.description: Earn progress by completing Vanguard Operations, Gambit and Crucible matches, or Seasonal playlist activities.
displayProperties.name: The Vow

2354690788.displaySource: "Last Guardian to hold that thing didn't last. Most think you're different. A legend in your own right. I'd be hard pressed to disagree. Still… Prove you can handle that Cannon, then we'll talk." —Banshee

displayProperties.description: Return to Banshee to receive your new Exotic weapon catalyst.
displayProperties.name: The Vow

55722089.displaySource: "My memory ain't what it was, but I know this: Anyone who risks a Moon run walks in the footsteps of lost heroes. Don't ever forget those who paved the way, or before long, you'll be one and the same." —Banshee

displayProperties.description: Investigate the strange Hive behavior near the Scarlet Keep.

displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

Return to Eris Morn with the Cleansed Essence.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
Eris used a Hive talisman of her own to create the first piece of protective armor.

To pass beyond the Pyramid's warding and discover what lies within, you'll need to wear a full set of Dreambane armor.

Take the first step and hunt the Nightmare of Omnigul.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description: Speak with Eris Morn to learn what she believes lies within the Scarlet Keep.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:

Launch the strike "The Scarlet Keep" from the Moon on the Director.

displayProperties.description:
Cleanse the Essence of Anguish dropped by Omnigul.

It can be viewed in the Quests tab of the Director.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

Hashladûn's death has yielded information of great value: the existence of the Hive Cryptoglyph and where to find it.

Return to Eris Morn with news of the Hive Cryptoglyph uncovered during the strike "The Scarlet Keep."
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
Somewhere in the horrific depths of the Hellmouth lies the Hive Cryptoglyph. With it, Eris Morn can craft further Dreambane armor for your quest to find a way inside the Pyramid.

The Cryptoglyph is yours to take from the Hive… if you can.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
Taking the Cryptoglyph from the Catacombs has interrupted the dark rituals planned by the Hidden Swarm… for now.

With the Cryptoglyph and Eris's magic, you should be able to craft further Dreambane armor.

Return to Eris Morn with the Cryptoglyph.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description: Use the Cryptoglyph to empower the Lectern of Enchantment near Eris Morn.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
Ikora has arrived on the Moon to see the Pyramid for herself and deliver a message.

Take the portal near Eris to meet Ikora in the Enduring Abyss on the Moon.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
Defeat the three remaining Nightmare bosses to collect their Essences: the Essence of Fear, the Essence of Isolation, and the Essence of Pride.

Each piece of Dreambane armor crafted is another step closer to entering the Pyramid and searching within for anything that can help stave off the impending threat Ikora has warned us about.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
You now have a full set of Dreambane armor. 

Return to Eris Morn for final preparations before entering the Pyramid.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description:
What secrets lie within the Pyramid? It sits in silence, waiting for you.

Head to the Enduring Abyss, past the Pyramid's warding, and find a way inside.
displayProperties.name: Legacy: Shadowkeep

displayProperties.description: Return to Eris Morn with the Unknown Artifact.

1285862604.displaySource: "I put my trust, and the Light of four others, in a madman. I bear witness to their fall into darkness and death. Toland's song was nothing but screams, and we go now to sing with them. We will not return." —Eriana-3

displayProperties.description:
Calibrate data and defeat targets while using Duality. 

Calibration occurs when you complete Vanguard Operations, Gambit and Crucible matches, or Seasonal playlist activities.

Higher-tier Nightfall completions and Crucible or Gambit wins provide additional progress.
displayProperties.name: Walk the Line

2652352679.displaySource: "Glint told me a story about a ship that belonged to someone named Theseus. Have you heard about it?" —Crow

displayProperties.description: Return to Banshee-44 to receive your reward.
displayProperties.name: Walk the Line

3387343924.displaySource:
Banshee-44 squints at the specs for the Duality. "Looks like somebody patched this together from scrap," he says. "They did a decent job of it, at least."

"Here's the problem," he says, pointing at the compression chamber. "I could pull combat data for pellets, or I could pull data for slugs. But both on one gun?"

He shrugs. "You'll have to do some serious calibration for this. Hope you're ready."

displayProperties.description:
In Crucible matches, defeat opponents with precision final blows, defeat opponents with melee final blows while using a [Stasis] Stasis subclass, and collect Stasis Essence.

Stasis Essence has a chance to drop when defeating frozen Guardians.
displayProperties.name: Timeless Victory

3679234405.displaySource: "Whatever you believe about Stasis, it's part of our arsenal now. We can either fumble around like children, or master it through practice." —Lord Shaxx

displayProperties.description:
Complete the listed objectives in Crucible matches.

Collect Crystalline Formations by defeating slowed Guardians.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Conquest

2719903032.displaySource: "The violence of the Crucible always seemed acceptable. A necessary method to strengthen ourselves. It feels different now, seeing Guardians frozen in Stasis…" —Ikora Rey

displayProperties.description: Complete the listed objectives in Crucible matches.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Strife

1490203679.displaySource: "Is it dangerous? Probably. But you don't win without taking risks, and with those things in the sky? This one seems worth it." —Marcus Ren

displayProperties.description:
Complete the listed objectives in Crucible matches.

Shatter damage is caused by shattering Stasis crystals and frozen targets.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Conflict

1930571866.displaySource: "Some would have you fear the power of Stasis, but few know the Darkness as intimately as I do. What you should truly fear is our future if we do not make use of this opportunity." —Eris Morn

displayProperties.description:
Complete the listed objectives in Gambit matches.

Shatter damage is caused by shattering Stasis crystals and frozen targets.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Plunder

435145886.displaySource: "Don't get caught up in the names, kid. I've seen plenty of dark things done by Lightbearers." —The Drifter

displayProperties.description: Complete the listed objectives in Gambit matches.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Hunger

3339057603.displaySource: "Big Blue's got a stick up his butt over this Stasis jam, like he does with most things. But it's just a tool. Someone smashes up your house, you don't blame the hammer." —The Drifter

displayProperties.description:
Complete the listed objectives in Gambit matches.

Umbral Particles can drop when banking Motes.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Schemes

1360203916.displaySource: "I see you. Playin' it off like Gambit's just something you do for practice. But when you hit that portal, froze that kid, and shattered him to pieces? I saw the smile on your face." —The Drifter

displayProperties.description: Complete the listed objectives in Gambit matches.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Riches

2308577369.displaySource: "I've never felt anything like it, being stuck in those shards. It doesn't even feel that cold, it's just… emptiness. Loneliness. I hate it." —Joxer

displayProperties.description: Complete the listed objectives in strikes and Vanguard playlists.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Flames

904478927.displaySource: "How many Humans were killed by Stasis in the Collapse? And now we're supposed to feel okay using it?" —Shaw Han

displayProperties.description:
Complete the listed objectives in strikes and Vanguard playlists.

Dark Reflections have a chance to drop from defeated strike bosses.
displayProperties.name: Umbral Duty

3963636042.displaySource: "The Light doesn't make Guardians special. It's what you choose to do with it. Seems like the same should be true for this new power, don't you think?" —Hawthorne

displayProperties.name: Umbral Incursions

2880619157.displaySource: "It's easy for us to justify the use of dangerous means when faced with a grave threat. But I look at the path we've started on, and I don't know where it ends." —Commander Zavala

displayProperties.name: Hunters' Remembrance

• The Minotaur requires a key from the Tower of the Deep.
• The Captain can be found after restoring a statue past the Descent.
• Restore a statue in the Eleusinia arena to reveal the Ogre.

displayProperties.description: Present purified Awoken mementos to the statue of Sjur Eido.

displayProperties.description: Return to Petra Venj for a debriefing. She will want to see the Awoken bow with her own eyes.

setData.questStepSummary: The bow thrums with whispers from the past. Distant and haunting, like a familar but half-forgotten melody. It is not an entirely comforting sound.

setData.questLineDescription:
A Golden Age Seraph complex has suddenly come online on Mars. Ana Bray and Osiris believe it could potentially threaten the restoration of Rasputin.

Venture into the "Spire of the Watcher" dungeon on Mars, discover its secrets, and stop any nefarious plots you uncover.
setData.questStepSummary: Ikora Rey's Hidden agents have reported a Seraph complex—offline since the Collapse—has recently powered on. What's more is that the associated area of Mars has Vex signatures converging on it. Osiris is determined to investigate, and Ikora urges you to go in his stead.

displayProperties.description: Return to Ikora Rey in the Tower Bazaar and report your success.
displayProperties.name: Ares Desperado

setData.questLineDescription:
A Golden Age Seraph complex has suddenly come online on Mars. Ana Bray and Osiris believe it could potentially threaten the restoration of Rasputin.

Venture into the "Spire of the Watcher" dungeon on Mars, discover its secrets, and stop any nefarious plots you uncover.
setData.questStepSummary: You've completed the "Spire of the Watcher" and foiled the Sol Divisive's plans… but perhaps more importantly, the data gathered from your adventure may provide some clarity to Osiris's cryptic visions.

displayProperties.name: Magnum Opus II

setData.questStepSummary: Prove to Starhorse that you are worthy of obtaining the weapon part Xûr found using the Access Card by performing well in Dares of Eternity.

displayProperties.description: Bring the Anomalous Weapon Part back to Banshee in the Tower to install it on your Forerunner.
displayProperties.name: Magnum Opus II

setData.questStepSummary: The Anomalous Weapon Part clearly has the same paraversal origin as your Forerunner weapon. Weapons expert Banshee might be able to tell you more.

displayProperties.name: Eternity Beckons

setData.questStepSummary: Mysterious powers wish to see you compete in the Dares of Eternity. Equally mysterious prizes await…
